items.message:
River levels are falling. Flooding is still expected to affect locations near the Bristol Avon, Tetbury Avon, Sherston Avon, Dauntsey Brook, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around low lying areas in Tetbury, Badminton, Brook End at Luckington, Corsham, Lacock and the road at Reybridge. Further showers are forecast for the rest of the week but are not expected to cause any further flooding. 

Our incident response staff are checking rivers for blockages and clearing debris from weed screens to reduce the risk of flooding. Please avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded and keep up to date with the weather forecast for your area. Never drive through flood water, just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car. Don't put yourself or others at risk.

 This message will be updated by 11:00 AM tomorrow 15/12/2025 or as the situation changes.

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Churn, Hilcot Brook, Daglingworth Stream, Gumstool Brook

items.message:
"High river levels may lead to flooding. Flooding remains possible.

Flooding of low lying land and roads is expected to continue overnight, 14 December 2025, along the River Churn around Cerney Wick. The forecast is for a dry night and morning tomorrow, 15 December 2025. Showers may develop during the afternoon tomorrow. Levels remain high but are starting to drop very slowly. We expect river levels to remain high over the coming days.

We are closely monitoring the situation. Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses. Go to River levels online for updates on current river levels.

This message will be updated by 09:00 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes."

items.message:

We expect levels to drop below the flood risk threshold over the coming 24 hours.

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. 

This message will be updated by 09:00 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes."

Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from Wolverley to Newport. Other locations that may be affected include Market Drayton, Wem, and Rodington. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes

We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. 

Avoid low lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded.

River levels remain high at the Stinsford river gauge on the Lower Frome after recent rainfall. Flooding is forecast to affect low lying areas to start with near to the River Frome in the Dorchester, West Stafford, Bockhampton, Lewell, Tincleton, Pallington, Waddock, Moreton, Wool, East Stoke, Holmebridge, Stoborough, Stoborough Green, Wareham, Redcliffe, Ridge and Swineham areas. The weather is set to continue to improve over the weekend. Some rain is forecast to come in Monday and Tuesday early next week. We will continue to monitor the forecast and re-issue this Flood Alert if necessary. Please avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. People in this area should take action now and watch your local weather forecast. This message will be updated by 10:00 AM on 15 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high. Flooding is possible today, 14 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the River Lugg south of Leominster from Stoke Prior to Mordiford. Other locations that may be affected include Bodenham, Lugwardine and Hampton Bishop. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: The tidal Rivers Bure, Ant and Thurne
items.message: Tide locking, where high tides restrict normal drainage of the river out to sea, may lead to flooding today and over the next few days. We expect to see high water levels around Potter Heigham, Wroxham boat yards and Ferry Road in Horning. River levels may remain high over the next couple of days. Avoid low-lying roads near rivers, which may be flooded. We are closely monitoring the situation. This message will be updated by 10am tomorrow, Monday 15 December 2025, or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Yeo and River Parrett Moors around Muchelney and Thorney
items.message: The Yeo and Parrett rivers remain high following rainfall on Tuesday. As a result, this Flood Alert remains in force. The remainder of Sunday will be mainly dry, however rain is forecast tomorrow. The current river level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 7.81m and is falling. The current drain level at Huish Episcopi pumping station is 7.04m and is steady. Flooding will affect the road from Langport to Muchelney if this level exceeds 7.3m; the road from Muchelney to Long Load above 7.86m; the road from Muchelney to Thorney above 7.93m and the road from Muchelney to Drayton above 8.8m. We continue to monitor rainfall and river levels. Pumping operations will continue when river levels allow. Avoid driving through flood water. Refer to the local authority website for any local road closures. This message will be updated by 1:00PM on 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 14 December 2025.
River levels remain high due to recent rainfall. Flooding may continue over the next few days.
Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent the River Severn from Tewkesbury to Gloucester. Locations that may be affected include Apperley, Maisemore, Hempstead, Minsterworth Ham and Quedgley. Severn Ham, Tewkesbury starts to fill.
Recorded peaks:-
Mythe peaked at 3.80m on Thursday 11/12/25
Haw Bridge peaked at 4.75m on Thursday 11/12/25
No flooding is expected at other gauge locations currently.
Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours which may see river levels rise further.
We are closely monitoring the situation.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses .
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

There is no longer a threat of flooding, though standing water and debris may still remain.

We will continue to monitor the situation and will issue further alerts or warnings if necessary.   
Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.message:
Forecast rising river levels overnight may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the early hours of 15 December 2025 . 
Heavy rainfall is forecast for the area overnight Sunday into Monday.

Forecast levels may cause flooding to low lying land and roads close to the river from around 6:30AM on Monday. The main areas of concern are Lynton, Lynmouth, Challacombe, Meethe, South Molton, Dulverton, Brushford, Winsford, Exton and Exford.

We expect rivers to remain high throughout the day. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and will issue flood warnings if required. 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water .

Forecast high river levels over the next two days may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible from the afternoon of 14 December 2025 until the morning of Tuesday 16 December 2025. 
River Calder from Brighouse to Castleford including Chickenley Beck, Spring Mill Beck and Waindike. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers. We are expecting a heavier burst of rain between midday and 2pm which is likely to generate surface water flooding. From 6pm we will see more persistent rain which will continue until the early hours of Tuesday morning and this will likely impact rivers. 
We are closely monitoring the situation and it is possible we may need to issue flood warnings overnight. 
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses . 
This message will be updated by 11:00PM on 14 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: Rivers Duddon, Crake and Mill Beck

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Duddon, River Crake, Mill Beck

items.message:
Flooding continues to be possible on 14 and 15 December 2025 .

Persistent rainfall is forecast today (14/12/2025) until Monday (15/12/2025), which will cause the river and lake levels to rise however, we do not expect Flood Warnings to be issued at this time. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near rivers Duddon, Crake, Mill Beck and other watercourses from Coniston to Barrow-in-Furness including low lying areas around Ulpha, Duddon Bridge, Broughton in Furness, Kirkby-in-Furness, Dalton in Furness and Ulverston.

We are closely monitoring the situation.

Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

River levels remain high but are falling today 14 December 2025. Flooding is possible. Flooding may affect low lying land and roads adjacent to the river from the Welsh border at Llawnt to Shrawardine near Shrewsbury. Other locations that may be affected include Llanymynech, Maesbrook and Melverley. Roads between Maesbrook, Melverley and Pentre start to flood. Peaks - Llanymynech peaked at 4.60m on Tuesday, Cae Howel peaked at 5.29m on 11/12. We are closely monitoring the situation. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Flooding may affect  low-lying land and roads adjacent to the River Sow between Great Bridgeford and Shugborough, the River Penk between Coven and Stafford, the Sandyford Brook, the Rising Brook, the Ridings Brook and the Saredon Brook. 
We are closely monitoring the situation . 
Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water . 
This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.description: River Dee catchment in England from Whitchurch to Chester
items.message:
Levels remain high today, 14th December 2025, and are expected to remain high for the next few days. 
Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads around the River Dee at Shocklach, Farndon, Handley, Lower Kinnerton, Chester and Puddington. Townfield Lane is currently impassable. We are not currently expecting to issue flood warnings.  
We are monitoring rainfall and river levels.
Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses and do not attempt to walk or drive through flood water. 
This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 15th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

Flooding continues to be possible on 14 and 15 December 2025 .

Persistent rainfall is forecast throughout Sunday (14/12/2025) and Monday (15/12/2025), which will cause river levels to rise however, we do not expect Flood Warnings to be issued at this time. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near river Eden and its tributaries from its confluence with the River Irthing through Crosby-on-Eden and Carlisle to the Solway Firth at Rockcliffe.


We are closely monitoring the situation.


Avoid using low lying footpaths and any bridges near local watercourses.


This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 14 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land & roads adjacent to the river from Highley to Tewkesbury; including Dog Lane Bewdley, Stourport, Diglis & Hylton Road towpath. Flooded drains affect the racecourse & Worcester CCG. PLP should be installed. New St Gate closed at Upton upon Severn. Observed peaks:- Bewdley 3.49m Friday 12/12, Worcester 4.07m Saturday 13/12, Diglis 3.71m Saturday 13/12, Kempsey Yacht Club 5.82m Thursday 11/12, Saxons Lode 4.41m Thursday 11/12. Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours which may see river levels rise further. We are closely monitoring the situation.  Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

High river levels today may lead to flooding. Flooding is possible on 14 December 2025. Flooding may affect low lying land and Squires Walk in the area of the Hatfield Brook Kempsey. Kempsey Flood Alleviation Scheme is operational. Observed peak:- Kempsey Yacht Club 5.82m Thursday, 11/12/25. Further rainfall is forecast over the next 48 hours which may see river levels rise further. We are closely monitoring the situation.  Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Never drive through flood water,  just 30cm of fast flowing water is enough to move your car.

items.description: Groundwater flooding in the West of Dorset
items.message:
Rising groundwater levels may lead to flooding. 
Flooding is possible in the West Dorset area
Groundwater levels are rising in response to recent heavy rainfall. Levels may continue to rise and flooding of fields and roads is possible. Levels are reactive to further rainfall. Some further rainfall is expected Friday and across the weekend which may see levels react further.  Where groundwater is near the surface, intense rainfall will lead to surface water flooding.  We are closely monitoring the situation . Residents are advised to prepare property resilience measures and ensure that pumps are working where they have been installed. 
This message will be updated by 4:00PM on 16 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

We are expecting a heavier burst of rain between midday and 2pm which is likely to generate surface water flooding. From 6pm we will see more persistent rain which will continue until the early hours of Tuesday morning and this will likely impact rivers.

Heavy rainfall over the last few days keeps the river level high at the Briantspuddle gauge station. Flooding of roads and low lying land is possible. Flooding is forecast to affect locations near the River Piddle, with low lying land and roads expected to be most affected, particularly around tributaries between Alton Pancras and Wareham. The weather is set to continue to improve over the weekend. There is  rain forecast Tuesday next week. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. Consider activating any flood protection products you may have and monitor local water levels and weather conditions. This message will be updated by 11:00AM on 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

items.message: River levels remain high. As a result, flooding is possible today, Sunday 14th December 2025. Locations most affected will be low lying land and roads near the River Foulness and the Market Weighton Canal and their tributaries, particularly around Welham Bridge. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels and liaising with emergency services and local authorities. Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water. Monitor local water levels and weather conditions. This message will be updated by 20:00PM on Sunday 14th December 2025, or as the situation changes.

Flooding continues to be expected on 14 December 2025 and 15 December 2025 

Following Saturday and Sunday's rain, river and Derwent Water lake levels are rising. We are not expecting to issue warnings for the rivers at this time. Derwent Water will continue to rise and we expect it to peak on Monday but will remain high into Tuesday. Todays weather forecast shows we are expecting slow moving persistent rain throughout the day 14 December 2025.

Locations most affected will be Keswick Campsite flooding from the lake. 

We are closely monitoring the situation. 

Take care and avoid walking, cycling or driving through flood water Take particular care if walking around the lake shore. 

This message will be updated by 10:00AM on 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes.

Continue to take care on waterside roads and footpaths and don't put yourself in unnecessary danger. Stay away from floodwater - it contains hidden dangers such as open manhole covers, sewage and chemicals.

items.description: River Yeo and Parrett, The Levels

floodArea.riverOrSea: River Yeo, River Parrett, Kings Sedgemoor Drain, River Sowy

items.message: Levels remain high on the Rivers Yeo and Parrett following rainfall on Tuesday. River and drain levels are still high in the lowland areas around Huish Episcopi, Langport, the River Sowy and King's Sedgemoor. The remainder of Sunday will be mainly dry, however rain is forecast tomorrow. This flood alert will remain in force whilst levels remain high. Flooding will affect areas near the Rivers Yeo, Parrett, Kings Sedgemoor Drain and Sowy, with low lying land and roads most affected, including Westover Trading Estate at Langport. We are monitoring rainfall and river levels. We are checking defences, bridges, culverts and screens. We have now commenced pumping and will continue to do so when river levels allow. Take care and avoid driving through flood water. This message will be updated by 1.00PM on 15 December 2025 or as the situation changes.
